isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 2 SPEED REAR AXLES: SPICER - ASSEMBLE - RING GEAR AND SUPPORT CASE

figure.caption: Figure 21. Ring Gear and Support Case Reassembly

step1.para: Install differential bearing cone onto hub of right hand half of differential support case.
Install differential bearing cone onto hub of left hand half of differential support case.

note.para: To protect bearings during the following steps, install bearing cups on bearing cones.

step1.para: Apply lubricant to thrust washer surfaces and install in differential support case.
Install differential assembly in differential support case. Rotate differential assembly to assure proper installation.
Install ring gear on differential support case, aligning bolt holes. Make sure ring gear is seated.

note.para: If old gear is used, make sure match marks are aligned.

step1.para: Lubricate and install the four (4) planet gear shafts in the holes of the differential case. Place the planet gears in position on the planet gear shafts.

note.para: Remove any burrs from planet gear mounting plate.

step1.para: Position the planetary gear mounting plate on the planet gear shafts and dowels with the chamfered teeth facing the planet gears. Tap the plate with a soft hammer, if necessary, to seat the plate against the differential case.

note.para: Be sure that the planet gear shafts and dowel pins are flush or below flush prior to installing thrust plate.

step1.para: Apply lubricant to each side of the differential support case thrust plate and position the thrust plate on the planet gear mounting plate.
Place the left differential support case on the ring gear and line up the bolt holes. If old ring gear is used, make sure match marks are aligned.
